clinical_study.brief_title: Proprioception and Sensorimotor Control in Hereditary Sensory and Autonomic Neuropathy
clinical_study.official_title: Proprioception and Sensorimotor Control in Hereditary Sensory and Autonomic Neuropathy

lead_sponsor.agency: New York University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: New York University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock:
This project comprises three sets of physiological studies - testing eight specific hypotheses - that will contribute new knowledge on proprioception and motor control in a genetic disorder that affects specific components of the sensory nervous system.
I: To investigate the neurophysiological basis for disturbed motor control in Hereditary sensory and autonomic neuropathy (HSAN) III II: To investigate the effects of enhancing cutaneous feedback on motor control in HSAN III III: To investigate the cortical representation of proprioceptive inputs in HSAN III

detailed_description.textblock: HSAN III patients (n=15) and healthy control subjects (n=15) will lay supine on an MRI bed and a tungsten microelectrode inserted percutaneously into a muscle or cutaneous fascicle of the right common peroneal nerve at the fibular head, according to standard techniques employed by Prof Macefield. Neural activity will be acquired, RMS-processed (200 ms) and analysed on computer. The subject's head will be tightly enclosed in a standard clinical 32-channel SENSE head coil and headphones will be provided to minimize noise and to allow communication with the subject. The subject will be placed in the bore of a 3T whole-body scanner for 60-90 minutes.

primary_outcome.measure: Measurement of gait in HSAN III

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed genetic diagnosis of HSAN III will be recruited from the Dysautonomia Center at NYU
Exclusion Criteria:
- homeless
- active drug or alcohol dependence
- evidence of neurological disorder or diabetes
- exposure to neurotoxic drugs that in the investigator's opinion may compromise results
- Pregnant women
